**Tournament Details:**

* The inaugural match of Major League Cricket will take place on July 13 at Grand Prairie Stadium in the Dallas area.
* The tournament will feature six teams and will run from July 13 to July 30.
* The Grand Prairie Stadium will host 12 matches during the tournament.

**Inaugural Match:**

* The hometown Texas Super Kings will host the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the inaugural match.
* The match will start at 7:30 p.m. and will feature pre-game pageantry, including a National Anthem performance, aerial acrobatics, and a drone show.
* The drone show will animate the sky with the logos of the six teams competing in the tournament.
* The match will be followed by fireworks.

**Star Players:**

* The tournament will feature several superstar players, including Rashid Khan, Faf du Plessis, David Miller, Sunil Narine, Kieron Pollard, Andre Russell, Marcus Stoinis, Aaron Finch, Jason Roy, Sikandar Raza, Wanindu Hasaranga, Ambati Rayudu, and Trent Boult.

**Tickets:**

* A limited number of tickets are still available for purchase, starting at $30. Fans can buy tickets at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com.

The MLC has secured several broadcast deals for its tournament, including:

* Willow TV (US and Canada) for 5 years
* TNT Sports (UK)
* Fox Sports (Australia)
* Sky NZ (New Zealand)
* A Sports (Pakistan)
* SuperSport (South Africa)
* SportsMax (Caribbean)

Additionally, the MLC has announced new sponsors for its inaugural season, including:

* Abound (money transfer app)
* Betway (online betting brand)
* Kloth (umpire and staff apparel supplier)
* Access Healthcare (shirts sponsor for Texas Super Kings)

The tournament's opening match between Texas Super Kings and Los Angeles Knight Riders has sold out, and will take place on July 13th at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**MLC 2023 Final**

* MI New York won the first-ever Major League Cricket title by defeating Seattle Orcas by 7 wickets.
* Nicholas Pooran was the star of the match, scoring 137 runs off 55 balls, including 10 fours and 13 sixes, to help MI New York chase down the target of 183/9 in just 16 overs.
* Seattle Orcas batted first and scored 183/9, with Quinton de Kock top-scoring with 87 runs.
* MI New York captain Nicholas Pooran was named the MVP of MLC Season 1.

**Final Match**
The final match was played between MI New York and Seattle Orcas, with MI New York winning the tournament. Seattle Orcas set a target of 184, and MI New York chased it down with Nicholas Pooran scoring 137 not out off 55 balls, including 10 boundaries and 13 sixes.

**Individual Performances**

**Tournament Details**

* The inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) will feature 19 games played at two venues: Dallas and Morrisville.
* The tournament will have six teams based in popular American cities: Los Angeles, Texas, New York, Washington DC, San Francisco, and Seattle.
* Three teams have been purchased by IPL side owners: Chennai Super Kings (Texas), Mumbai Indians (New York), and Kolkata Knight Riders (Los Angeles).

**Viewing Information**

* The tournament will be broadcast live on Sports18 channel on TV.
* All games will be available for streaming on the Jiocinema app and website.

**Significance**

* The MLC aims to expand cricket beyond traditional territories and provide a platform for young players to play with international T20 players.
* The tournament could serve as a precursor to more cricket games in the US, with a T20 World Cup scheduled for June next year.

* MLC is owned by American Cricket Enterprises, backed by the founders of Willow TV, the largest cricket broadcaster in North America.

* The tournament will feature six teams: San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles, New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas, and Washington DC.
* The competition is scheduled to begin on July 13, 2023, and will comprise 19 games played over 18 days, culminating in the grand finale on July 30.
* Delhi Capitals (DC) will partner with the Seattle Orcas, while Chennai Super Kings (CSK) is reportedly considering taking a stake in the Texas team.
* Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) has taken control of the Los Angeles franchise, and Mumbai Indians (MI) will direct the New York franchise.
* The MLC Domestic Player Draft is scheduled to take place in Houston, with over 100 players qualified to represent the USA cricket community in the competition.
* The remainder of each team's player roster will be filled with top T20 cricketers from around the globe.

** Dates:** The first-ever Major League Cricket will take place from July 13 to July 30 in the United States of America.

**Sanctioning:** The tournament has been sanctioned by the USA Cricket and the International Cricket Council (ICC), although player records will not be reflected on their profiles since the USA is not a full member country.

**Venues:** The tournament will be held in two cities: Texas (Grand Prairie Stadium) and Morrisville (Church Street Park).

**Teams and Squad Rules:** There are six teams participating: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. Each team can pick a maximum of 19 players and a minimum of 16 players, with a maximum of nine international stars and at least one under-23 player from the USA. Teams can select five domestic stars and six overseas players in their final XIs.

**Notable Players:** Indian players Unmukt Chand, Harmeet Singh, Chaitanya Bishnoi, Tajinder Singh, Smit Patel, and Shubham Ranjane will participate in the tournament. Ambati Rayudu was initially set to participate but withdrew due to the BCCI's cooling-off period rules.

**Broadcasting:** All matches will be broadcast live and exclusively on Willow.tv in the US and Canada.

**Tournament Overview**
The inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) season is underway in the United States. The tournament features six teams, with four of them owned or part-owned by Indian Premier League (IPL) franchises.

**Teams and Schedule**
The six teams are: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom. Each team will play each other once, followed by playoffs and a final on July 31.

**Star Players**
The tournament has attracted big names like Quinton de Kock, Jason Roy, Wanindu Hasaranga, Anrich Nortje, Martin Guptill, Aaron Finch, and Trent Boult.

**Venues**
All games will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, or Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Broadcasting and Live Streaming**
The tournament will be streamed live on Jio Cinema in India for free. Viewers outside India can use a VPN to unblock the stream. In Australia, the tournament will be broadcast on Kayo Sports, and in the US, it will be on Willow TV.

**Overview**: The Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional Twenty20 cricket league in the United States, operated by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) and sanctioned by USA Cricket.

**History**: The idea of a T20 cricket league in the US dates back to 2004, but it wasn't until 2018 that USA Cricket announced plans to establish a domestic T20 league. ACE was chosen to operate the league, and the first season of Minor League Cricket (MiLC) was played in 2021.

**Inaugural Season**: The inaugural season of MLC took place from July 13 to 30, 2023, at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina. Six teams participated, with MI New York winning the title.

**Teams**: There are six teams in the league, each owned by ACE and operated by investor-operators. The teams are: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

**Tournament Format**: The league features a round-robin format, with each team playing 15 matches. The top four teams qualify for the playoffs, with the final taking place on July 30.

**Player Draft**: The inaugural player draft was held on March 19, 2023, with each team having a purse of over $1 million.

**2024 Season**: The second season of MLC is scheduled to begin on July 4, 2024, with matches to be played at Grand Prairie Stadium and other venues.

**Venues**: The league plans to build cricket stadiums in several locations, including Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, and Washington, D.C.

The inaugural edition of the MLC has finally kicked off in the United States, marking a significant milestone for cricket in the country. The tournament has assembled an impressive array of investors, with four of its six franchises owned by business entities that also own teams in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The MLC aims to break new ground in the US market, which is currently dominated by baseball, basketball, and American football. The tournament has assembled a strong team, including West Indies' Kieron Pollard, who is confident that MLC will take cricket "prime-time" in the US. The launch of MLC is seen as a significant step towards raising awareness of the game in the US, with potential to increase its popularity and pave the way for its inclusion in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics. Tom Dunmore, MLC's marketing vice president, believes that the tournament will bring new investments, infrastructure, and resources to the sport, and co-hosting the T20 World Cup next year with West Indies will further boost cricket's profile in the US.

**Basic Rules**

* Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played by two teams of 11 players each on an oval-shaped field.
* The objective is to score runs by hitting the ball and exchanging places with the other batsman.
* A batsman can get out if the ball hits the wicket, or if the fielding team catches the ball or knocks the bails off the wicket.

**Scorekeeping**

* The team with the most runs at the end of the innings wins.
* The scoreboard displays the runs, overs, and wickets for each team.

**Overs**

* A bowler can only bowl six deliveries at a time, known as an over.
* The fielding team must switch bowlers after each over.
* A player can bowl multiple times in an innings, but not consecutively.

**Overview**
Major League Cricket (MLC) was launched in the United States in 2023, with ownership groups from the Indian Premier League (IPL) bringing their franchises to the USA. The inaugural season featured six teams and 19 games, including four playoff games, and saw a competitive series with sell-out crowds.

**Star Power**
The league attracted international stars like Jason Roy, Liam Plunkett, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, and Kagiso Rabada, which contributed to its competitive nature and appeal to American audiences.

**Sustainability**
The sustainability of MLC is a concern, as it competes with an already packed cricket schedule. The league's ability to attract top-tier English talent, who are often busy with international commitments, is a challenge. Additionally, the league needs to navigate its place in the cricketing calendar to avoid conflicts with other major competitions.

**Contracts and Player Availability**
MLC's affiliation with IPL franchises could work in its favor, as players like Jofra Archer, who have been offered lucrative contracts, may choose to play for their IPL teams over representing their national teams. This could lead to a shift in the way players prioritize their commitments.

**Future Outlook**
The future of MLC depends on its ability to sustain interest and appeal to American audiences beyond the initial novelty. The league needs to address its place in the cricketing calendar, avoid conflicts with other competitions, and navigate the complexities of player contracts and availability.

**What is MLC?**: MLC is a Twenty20 cricket competition scheduled to launch in 2022, featuring six franchises, with Dallas and Los Angeles already confirmed as team locations.

**Objective**: The tournament aims to increase cricket's popularity in the US, following the success of the Indian Premier League (IPL).

**Key figures**: Investors include technology giants' CEOs, such as Microsoft's Satya Nadella, and Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan, who will own the Los Angeles Knight Riders franchise.

**Growth plan**: MLC is part of USA Cricket's foundational plan to grow cricket's American following and improve the national team. A 24-team Minor League Cricket competition will serve as a pipeline to MLC.

**Challenges**: MLC will face obstacles, including competing with established American sports leagues for media and sponsorship attention.

**Confidence**: Founders are optimistic, citing the success of the Indian Premier League and the potential to engage with existing cricket fans among the 6 million Americans of Indian and South Asian origin.

**Title Winner:** MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard, won the inaugural Major League Cricket title.

Major League Cricket (MLC), the first professional T20 cricket league in the United States, has secured broadcasting deals with CBS Sports and Sling TV to enhance its broadcast offering in the US market.

**Introduction**: The article discusses the launch of Major League Cricket (MLC), a professional cricket league in the United States, which aims to popularize the sport in America.

**Background**: Cricket has struggled to gain traction in the US, with failed attempts to launch domestic leagues in the past. However, MLC has secured significant funding ($50m already spent, with another $130m on the way) and has partnered with Indian Premier League franchises and Australian state cricket bodies.

**Tournament details**: The inaugural tournament will feature six teams, playing each other once, with the top four teams contesting the final on July 30. The games will be played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and a 3,000-capacity ground in North Carolina. The league has secured a mainstream broadcast partner and will be shown live on Willow TV.

**Teams and players**: The teams for the inaugural season include the Washington Freedom, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Texas Super Kings, and MI New York. Notable players include Wanindu Hasaranga, Kagiso Rabada, Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Aaron Finch, and Rashid Khan.

**Challenges and prospects**: Despite the challenges faced by cricket in the US, MLC's organizers are optimistic about the league's potential, citing the growing Indian-American population and the success of Major League Soccer as a template for expansion. The league aims to develop local talent, build a stadium in each home city, and eventually expand to 10 teams with a longer season.

**Conclusion**: The launch of MLC marks a significant attempt to popularize cricket in America, with a high-profile tournament featuring international stars and local talent. While the road ahead presents obstacles, the league's organizers are confident about the sport's appeal to American audiences.

**Launch Date:** The MLC tournament is set to launch on July 13, 2023.

**Opening Match:** The opening match will take place at the newly-constructed Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas.

**Venue:** Grand Prairie Stadium, with a seating capacity of 7,200, will be the primary venue for the 2023 season and home to the Dallas MLC team. The stadium is currently under construction and is expected to be completed in spring 2023.

**Future Plans:** Several other US cricket venues are planned, but slow progress may result in Grand Prairie Stadium being the sole host for MLC's debut season. The MLC has secured significant funding to support the development of stadiums and training centers across the US.
